intro: Acrosanthes angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf banksia, is a flowering plant native to the south-west of Western Australia. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spike. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that are arranged in a dense, cylindrical cluster. Acrosanthes angustifolia typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate. It is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
